data.title: Indian bond yields to continue flattish trend as traders await RBI decision
data.description:
Indian government bond yields are expected to continue with their sideway moves on Wednesday, as market participants remain fully focused on the Reserve Bank of India's monetary policy decision on Friday.

The 10-year bond yield (IN067934G=CC) is likely to move between 6.65% and 6.69%, a trader with a private bank said, compared with Tuesday's close of 6.6732%.

"Market has been taken over by bulls and barring some profit-taking, there is not much selling interest, so we could see a further nudge downwards to bond yields," the trader said.

The central bank is widely expected to cut interest rates for the first time in nearly five years in Governor Sanjay Malhotra's first monetary policy review, aiming to boost economic growth which is seen falling to a four-year low.

A majority of economists and market participants are expecting a 25-basis-point cut from the RBI.

The RBI has also proactively started infusing liquidity in the banking system, which was an ask by market participants.

In the secondary market, the RBI has bought bonds worth 310 billion rupees ($3.56 billion) in two weeks to Jan. 24, while buying bonds through an open market operation last week.

Of the total purchases, one-fourth comprised of the benchmark paper.

The central bank infused around 440 billion rupees through a $5.1 billion forex swap last week, and will conduct 56-day repo on Feb. 7.

The RBI has also announced more OMO purchases of 200 billion rupees each on Feb. 13, and Feb. 20.

Ashhish Vaidya, managing director and treasurer - global financial markets, DBS Bank India, has said the RBI would likely buy bonds worth 2 trillion rupees in the next financial year and the slight rise in gross borrowing is immaterial.

India is targeting a gross borrowing of 14.82 trillion rupees in the next financial year, up from 14.01 trillion rupees.

KEY INDICATORS:

** Brent crude futures were 0.2% down at $76.05 per barrel, after rising 0.3% in the previous session

** Ten-year U.S. Treasury yield at 4.5166%; two-year yield (US2YT=RR) at 4.2200%

** RBI to auction treasury bills worth 280 billion rupees

** RBI to conduct 1-day variable rate repo auction for 250 billion rupees

($1 = 87.1530 Indian rupees)

data.title: China Stocks Drop as Market Reopens
data.description:
The Shanghai Composite fell 0.3% to around 3,240 on Wednesday as the market reopened following a week-long holiday, with investors confronting rising trade tensions and ongoing economic uncertainties.

E-commerce stocks were particularly pressured after the US Postal Service temporarily blocked parcels from China and Hong Kong in response to new tariffs.

On Tuesday, the US imposed a 10% tariff on Chinese goods, prompting Beijing to announce retaliatory tariffs on US exports, including oil, gas, coal, cars, and farm equipment, starting February 10.

Additionally, data revealed that China’s services sector growth slowed to a four-month low in January.

Notable losers included Zhongji Innolight (-14.7%), Foxconn Industrial (-6.9%), and Hand Enterprise (-3.9%).

data.title: SK Won Rise for 2nd Session After Inflation Data
data.description:
The South Korean won strengthened toward 1,450 per dollar, extending gains from the previous session, driven by the latest inflation figures.

Official data showed that South Korea's inflation rate rose to 2.2% in January 2025, the highest in six months, driven by a weaker currency that increased import costs.

This supported the Bank of Korea’s recent decision to keep interest rates at 3%, balancing economic growth concerns with currency pressures amid political instability.

Meanwhile, market sentiment improved after U.S. President Donald Trump suspended planned tariffs on imports from Mexico and Canada.

However, US-China trade tensions escalated with Beijing retaliating with countermeasures against US tariffs.

data.title: LG CNS Makes Weak Debut After IPO
data.description:
By Kwanwoo Jun

LG CNS, an information-technology services affiliate of conglomerate LG Group, made a weak debut in South Korea after the country's biggest initial public offering in three years.

Shares of LG CNS fell as much as 8.6% to 56,600 won, equivalent to $38.99, after opening at 60,500 won in their first day of trading on the Kospi stock exchange Wednesday. The shares pared some losses in later in the morning but remained below their IPO price of 61,900 won, the top end of their marketed price rage. The Kospi was recently up 0.9%.

The company, through an oversubscribed share sale in January, raised 1.199 trillion won, equivalent to $825.9 million. That marked the largest IPO in South Korea since 2022, when battery maker LG Energy Solution raised more than $10 billion.

The stock's lackluster performance put LG CNS's estimated market value at around $4 billion.

LG CNS plans to use the IPO proceeds for facility investments, acquisitions of other IT firms and debt repayment.

LG CNS said revenue rose 13% to 5.605 trillion won in 2023, while operating profit was up 12% at 464.05 billion won.

LG Corp., the holding company for LG Group, has a 45% stake in LG CNS.

Write to Kwanwoo Jun at kwanwoo.jun@wsj.com

data.title: Palm Oil Rises on Bullish Technical Outlook — Market Talk
data.description: Palm oil prices rise in early Asian trading, supported by a bullish technical outlook, AmInvestment Bank says in a note. The bank suggests traders to consider long positions if prices adjust. Meanwhile, Malaysia's palm oil production is expected to remain weak due to heavy rainfall. January output is estimated to have declined 10% from the previous month to 1.34 million tons, marking a fifth consecutive decline, according to a Bloomberg survey. Inventories may have dropped 2.9% to 1.66 million tons, while exports likely slumped 14.2% to 1.15 million tons, the survey shows. The Malaysian Palm Oil Board will release official data on Monday. AmInvestment Bank pegs CPO support at 4,251 ringgit/ton and resistance at 4,453 ringgit/ton. The Bursa Malaysia Derivatives contract for April delivery is 23 ringgit higher at 4,331 ringgit/ton. (yingxian.wong@wsj.com)

data.title: Bandai Namco Sees FY Net Y128.00B
Bandai Namco 9-Mos Net Y128.70B Vs Net Y60.40B
Eumundi Group Says Scheme of Arrangement Legally Effective
data.description:
Eumundi Group filed a copy of the Federal Court of Australia's approval of the scheme of arrangement under which SEQ Hospitality will buy all Eumundi shares for cash consideration of AU$1.62 per share, the company said in a Wednesday filing with the Australian bourse.

The copy was filed with the Australian Securities and Investment Commission, making the scheme legally effective, the filing said.

It is expected that Eumundi shares on the Australian Securities Exchange will be suspended from the close of Feb. 5, the filing added.

data.title: ASX Midday Sector Update: Materials Sector Upbeat, Healthcare Stocks Struggle
data.description:
Materials stocks rose almost 2% at midday Wednesday, leading a rally on the Australian bourse. Higher iron ore prices buoyed mining stocks after China announced retaliatory tariffs on US goods.

Rio Tinto Group is grappling with further iron ore shipment delays after Cyclones Taliah and Vince caused high seas off its Western Australian ports, according to multiple media reports, citing a company spokesperson. The company moved iron ore ships from Cape Lambert and Dampier ports to avoid dangerous wave conditions.

On the flip side, healthcare was the only sector trading in the red, shedding a little over 1%.

BlinkLab said PriMED Clinical Research in Ohio became the first site to join the initial phase of the firm's US-based autism diagnostic registrational trial. Its shares rose 10% in recent trading.

data.title: Japan's Marubeni targets over $4 bln net profit in FY 2027/28
data.description:
Japanese trading house Marubeni said on Wednesday it is aiming for a net profit of more than 620 billion yen ($4 billion) in fiscal year 2027/2028, with shareholder returns of 40% which should allow it to see a higher market capitalisation.

The company posted on Wednesday a 14.5% rise in nine-month net profit to 425.2 billion yen and revised its profit forecast for the fiscal year ending in March to 500 billion yen from a previous guidance of 480 billion yen.

In the fiscal year of 2030/2031, Marubeni sees its market capitalisation at over 10 trillion yen, nearly tripling from 3.8 trillion yen it has now. Marubeni's shares were up 3% by 0215 GMT.

The company plans to buy back up to 1.8% of its shares worth 30 billion yen, it added on Wednesday.

($1 = 153.3300 yen)

data.title: Shanghai copper eases on US-China trade tensions
data.description:
Shanghai copper prices eased on Wednesday as trading resumed after the Lunar New Year holidays, with fears of an escalation in trade tensions between the United States and top metals consumer China dampening market sentiment.

The most-active copper contract on the Shanghai Futures Exchange fell 0.4% to 75,280 yuan ($10,332.85) a metric ton by 0201 GMT. China's markets were closed from Jan. 28 to Feb. 4 for the Lunar New Year.

China on Tuesday imposed tariffs on some U.S. imports in a swift response to new U.S. duties on Chinese goods, raising the stakes in a showdown between the world's top two economies even as President Donald Trump offered reprieves to Mexico and Canada.

"This means that China's exports to the U.S will be subject to an additional tariff of 10%. This should not lead to any major distortions: only just below 4.5% of China's copper and aluminium exports go to the US," Commerzbank said in a note.

The package of retaliatory measures from China included stricter export regulations for tungsten and four other critical metals.

Market focus will be on if China announces further stimulus measures to boost its economy amid concerns about the tariff dispute with the United States and persistent worries about demand in the world's second-largest economy.

Three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange (LME) rose 0.2% to $9,171.5 a metric ton.

Three-month aluminium fell 0.3% to $2,630.5. LME zinc was steady at $2,807.5 a ton, tin added 0.3% to $30,370, lead climbed 0.2% to $1,974 and nickel gained 0.7% to $15,370.

SHFE aluminium rose 0.2% to 20,275 yuan a ton, nickel fell 0.5% to 123,440 yuan, zinc eased 0.8% to 23,440 yuan, lead gained 1.9% to 17,025 yuan and tin advanced 1.4% to 251,660 yuan.

($1 = 7.2855 Chinese yuan)

data.title: Australia's Pinnacle Investment hits record high on upbeat HY results
data.description:
** Shares of Pinnacle Investment Management rise 5.2% to A$26.46

** Stock earlier hit a record high of A$27.110

** Investment manager, after trading on Tuesday reported half-year profit attributable of A$75.7 million ($47.34 million), 151% rise against pcp

** Co announces interim dividend of 33 Australian cents per share

** Stock rose as much as 7.7% earlier in the day, marking its biggest intraday gain since Feb. 2, 2024

** Stock up over 15% so far this year, including the day's move

($1 = 1.5992 Australian dollars)

data.title: Gold Surges to Fresh High
data.description:
Gold surged past $2,850 per ounce on Wednesday, reaching a new record high, as investors sought safety assets amid growing concerns that a US-China trade war could hinder global growth.

US President Trump postponed tariffs on Mexico and Canada but proceeded with a 10% levy on all imports from China this week, prompting Beijing to announce retaliatory tariffs on US energy goods, set to take effect next week.

Adding to the uncertainty, Trump suggested that the US take control of the Gaza Strip and oversee its reconstruction.

Meanwhile, interest rate futures continued to signal market expectations of two US rate cuts this year, in contrast to last month's broad consensus of no cuts.

This outlook was reinforced by lower-than-expected job openings in the latest JOLTS report and a sharper-than-anticipated drop in factory orders to a six-month low.

data.title: Japan: robust wage growth bolsters case for Bank of Japan rate hikes - as early as May
data.description:
A note from ING points out that labour cash earnings increased more than anticipated in December, with November's data also revised higher.

ING adds that if this year's Shunto wage negotiations deliver results similar to last year's, the Bank of Japan is expected to raise rates by 25 basis points as early as May.

***

The data is here from earlier today:

  • Japan headline wages +4.8% y/y in December, real wages rise also

Also, this from earlier:

  • BoJ likely to raise ratees higher than most expects says former official Hideo Hayakawa

***

The yen has gained solidly during the session so far, and it still going:

data.title: Deepak Spinners' CFO Resigns
data.description: Yarn manufacturer Deepak Spinners said its chief financial officer Punam Chand Sharma has resigned from the company, with effect from Feb. 1, citing personal reasons, according to a Tuesday filing to the BSE.

data.title: Yuan weakens as fresh tariff war dogs post-holiday trade
data.description:
China's yuan weakened against the dollar on Wednesday in the first trading session after the week-long holiday, pressured by fresh trade disputes between the world's two largest economies.

Beijing on Tuesday slapped tariffs on U.S. imports in a rapid response to new U.S. duties on Chinese goods, renewing a Sino-American trade war as President Donald Trump sought to punish China for not halting the flow of illicit drugs.

But the losses in the yuan were capped by a persistent strengthening bias in central bank guidance, currency traders said, which they interpreted as an official attempt to rein in yuan weakness.

Prior to market opening, the People's Bank of China (PBOC) set the midpoint , around which the yuan is allowed to trade in a 2% band, at 7.1693 per dollar, its strongest since Nov. 8, 2024 and 968 pips firmer than a Reuters' estimate (CNY=RTRS) of 7.2661.

The central bank has been setting its official guidance on the firmer side of market projections since mid-November, which analysts and traders say is a sign of unease over the yuan's decline.

As of 0203 GMT, the onshore yuan was 0.65% lower at 7.2852 to the dollar, compared with the previous close of 7.2469 last week.

While the onshore yuan was closed for the Lunar New Year holiday since last Tuesday, its offshore counterpart has shed 0.6% against the dollar during the period and hit a lifetime low this week.

Investors will see any attempts by China to weaken the currency as a hint Beijing expects a protracted trade war and is using the yuan to counter the effect of tariffs, as it did during Trump's first term in 2018.

"While the tariffs imposed on China are not as aggressive as those on Mexico and Canada, this marks the beginning of another leg of the long-running trade war, with risks of further escalation," analysts at Barclays said in a note.

"We see intensified downside risk to the CNY and other Asian currencies such as KRW, MYR, and THB."

data.title: American Assets Trust Inc reports results for the quarter ended December 31 - Earnings Summary
data.description:

The mean expectation of two analysts for the quarter was for earnings of 7 cents per share. Wall Street expected results to range from 3 cents to 11 cents per share.

  • Revenue rose 0.9% to $113.46 million from a year ago; analysts expected $111.90 million.

  • American Assets Trust Inc's reported EPS for the quarter was 15 cents​.

  • The company reported quarterly net income of $8.98 million.

  • American Assets Trust Inc shares had fallen by 8.1% this quarter.

FORECAST CHANGES

  • In the last 30 days, one analyst negatively revised an earnings estimate

RECOMMENDATIONS

  • The current average analyst rating on the shares is "hold" and the breakdown of recommendations is no "strong buy" or "buy," 3 "hold" and no "sell" or "strong sell."

  • The average consensus recommendation for the commercial reits peer group is also "hold"

Wall Street's median 12-month price target for American Assets Trust Inc is $26.00

data.title: Yen Strengthens, Boosted by BOJ Rate-Hike Expectations, Tariff Worries — Market Talk
data.description: The yen strengthens against other G-10 and Asian currencies in the morning session. Japanese data released earlier showed the economy's real wages rose 0.6% in December from a year earlier, marking a second straight month of increases. A solid rise in Japanese labor cash earnings will reinforce the current market pricing in at least one more rate hike by the BOJ this year, CBA's Joseph Capurso says in a note. In addition, with the 'tariff war' between the U.S. and other countries seemingly ongoing, the AUD/JPY is likely to retest support at 94.69, the head of International and Sustainable Economics adds. USD/JPY falls 0.6% to 153.36; AUD/JPY drops 0.7% to 95.88. (ronnie.harui@wsj.com)

data.title: Japan Services PMI Signals Stronger Sector Growth — Market Talk
data.description: Japan's services sector is off to a strong start in 2025, the au Jibun Bank PMI compiled by S&P Global suggests. January data point to a solid upturn in business activity across the sector, accompanied by a steeper, solid rise in new business inflows. The survey signaled a sharp jump in average prices charged by service providers, while exports rose for the first time in four months. Firms are upbeat on their prospects over the coming 12 months and have boosted staffing levels, says Usamah Bhatti, economist at S&P Global Market Intelligence. Services continue to underpin growth in Japan's private sector, contrasting the weakness in manufacturing. Still, companies are confident that private-sector activity will rise over 2025, expecting a rebound in manufacturing output and a broad-based economic recovery, Bhatti says. (fabiana.negrinochoa@wsj.com)

data.title: Nickel Industries Says Indonesian Project has Potential to Contribute to Future Earnings
data.description:
Nickel Industries said its Sampala project in Indonesia has the potential to significantly contribute to future earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization, at a capital development cost of $50 million, according to a Wednesday filing with the Australian bourse.

The company said that drilling at the project enabled the finalization of mine plans and it is now focused on bringing the project into production at the soonest time frame, the filing said.

Production at the project will secure ore supply for the company's processing opportunities at the Indonesia Morowarli Industrial Park, the filing added.

Shares of the company rose 1% in recent Wednesday trade.

Cramer Pamela J.Chief Human Resources OfficerSell$53,605Form 4

Several executives at Rhythm Pharmaceuticals have recently sold shares of the company's common stock, all transactions occurring on February 4, 2025, at a price of $59.43 per share, under a Rule 10b5-1 plan.

Pamela J. Cramer, Chief Human Resources Officer, sold 902 shares, totaling $53,605, and now directly owns 15,248 shares.

Jennifer Kayden Lee, EVP, Head of North America, sold 1,447 shares, totaling $85,995, and now directly owns 4,038 shares.

David P. Meeker, President and CEO, sold 4,278 shares, totaling $254,241, and now directly owns 189,927 shares.

Joseph Shulman, Chief Technical Officer, sold 1,281 shares, totaling $76,129, and now directly owns 2,657 shares.

Smith Hunter C, Chief Financial Officer, sold 1,678 shares, totaling $99,723, and now directly owns 101,186 shares.

data.title: New Zealanders Still Waiting to See Recovery Light — Market Talk
data.description: Unemployment in New Zealand is still rising despite rapid interest-rate cuts since mid-2024, leaving consumers and business owners still searching to see the light of an economic recovery. Mark Smith, senior economist at ASB Bank expects demand for labor will continue to weaken until a modest economic recovery finally shows up in the second half of 2025. Firms will have to carefully manage employee headcount in that time, he adds. With inflation close to the target midpoint and monetary settings still slowing the economy, further swift monetary easing looks appropriate to limit economic and labor market scarring, he adds. (james.glynn@wsj.com; @JamesGlynnWSJ)
